name: Fiery Pasilla de Oaxaca Salsa
description: Here's an easy recipe for the fiery, smoky Pasilla de Oaxaca Salsa.  I like it borderline volcanic, but you can always dial back on the heat by reducing the chile amount.

recipeInstructions.text: Husk and rinse the tomatillos, cutting out the stems.  Roast the tomatillos in the oven at 400F for 15 minutes or so.
recipeInstructions.name: Husk and rinse the tomatillos, cutting out the stems.  Roast the tomatillos in the oven at 400F for 15 minutes or so.

recipeInstructions.text: Wipe off any dusty crevasses on the Pasilla de Oaxacas using a wet paper towel, then de-stem and de-seed them. Roast the chili pieces in the oven at 400F for 1-2 minutes.  Add the roasted chile pieces to a bowl and cover them with the hottest tap water you've got.  Let them reconstitute for 20-30 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Wipe off any dusty crevasses on the Pasilla de Oaxacas using a wet paper towel, then de-stem and de-seed them. Roast the chili pieces in the oven at 400F for 1-2 minutes.  Add the roasted chile pieces to a bowl and cover them with the hottest tap water you've got.  Let them reconstitute for 20-30 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the reconstituted chiles and add the chile pieces to a blender along with the roasted tomatillos, 2 peeled garlic cloves, a sliver of onion, and a pinch of salt.  Combine well, tasting for salt and heat level.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the reconstituted chiles and add the chile pieces to a blender along with the roasted tomatillos, 2 peeled garlic cloves, a sliver of onion, and a pinch of salt.  Combine well, tasting for salt and heat level.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately and store leftovers in an airtight container in the fridge.
